str2: And, even, also, namely.
Where, whither, in what place. From hos and pou; what(-ever) where, i.e. At whichever spot.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To journey in(to), I go in(to), enter, intervene. From eis and poreuomai; to enter.
A village, country town. From keimai; a hamlet.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
From ago; a field; genitive case, the country; specially, a farm, i.e. Hamlet.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To put, place, lay, set, fix, establish. A prolonged form of a primary theo to place.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To be weak (physically: then morally), To be sick. From asthenes; to be feeble.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From ageiro; properly, the town-square; by implication, a market or thoroughfare.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Prop: I fasten to; I lay hold of, touch, know carnally. Reflexive of hapto; properly, to attach oneself to, i.e. To touch.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The fringe, edge, corner, tassel. Of uncertain derivation; a margin, i.e., a fringe or tassel.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A long flowing outer garment, tunic. Neuter of a presumed derivative of ennumi; a dress.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: How much, how great, how many, as great as, as much. By reduplication from hos; as As.
A primary particle, denoting a supposition, wish, possibility or uncertainty.

str2: Prop: I fasten to; I lay hold of, touch, know carnally. Reflexive of hapto; properly, to attach oneself to, i.e. To touch.

str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To save, heal, preserve, rescue. From a primary sos; to save, i.e. Deliver or protect.
